TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListViewItem/ListViewSubItemCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
type ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects stored in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects that represent subitems of a parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. Subitems are only displayed in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when columns are specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Columns%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control and when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>. The order of subitems in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> determines the columns the subitems are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
There are a number of ways to add subitems to the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method adds a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> to the collection. To add a number of subitems to the collection, you create an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and pass it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method. If you want to insert a subitem at a specific location in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method. To remove subitems, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the subitem is located in the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Clear%2A> method enables you to remove all subitems from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single subitem at a time.
In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing subitems, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> also provides methods to find subitems in the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is a member of the collection. Once you know that the subitem is located in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the subitem is located in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.

Docs.summary: Adds a subitem to the collection of subitems.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem/ListViewSubItem Add(string text) cil managed
Public Function Add (text As String) As ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem

Docs.param: The text to display for the subitem.
Docs.summary: Adds a subitem to the collection with specified text.
Docs.returns: The that was added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add a subitem to the collection by specifying the text of the subitem. When this method is called, a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is created with the specified text. You can then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that is returned by this method to set properties and call methods to manipulate the subitem. If you already have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that you want to add to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> as a parameter, or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add the subitem at a specific position within the collection.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control with three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects specified and three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects specified for each item. The example also creates <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects to display the subitems in details view. Two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> objects are also created in the code example to provide images for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects. These <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> objects are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.LargeImageList%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> properties. The example uses the following properties in creating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control:
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.LabelEdit%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AllowColumnReorder%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckBoxes%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.FullRowSelect%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.GridLines%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sorting%2A>
This example requires that you have added the code to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> and call the method created in the example from the constructor or another method on the form. The example also requires that images named `MySmallImage1`, `MySmallImage2`, `MyLargeImage1`, and `MyLargeImage2` are located in the root directory of drive C.
[!code-cpp[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method to add an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> to the collection. This method is typically used to reuse existing subitems from other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects. Items that are added to the collection are inserted at the end of the list. To insert an item into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method. If you want to add an array of existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.

Docs.summary: Adds a subitem to the collection with specified text, foreground color, background color, and font settings.
Docs.returns: The that was added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add a subitem to the collection by specifying the text of the subitem. In addition, this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to specify the initial foreground color, background color, and font of the subitem text. When this method is called, a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is created with the specified text. You can then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that is returned by this method to set properties and call methods to manipulate the subitem. If you already have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that you want to add to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> as a parameter, or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add the subitem at a specific position in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > By default, subitems use the foreground color, background color, and font specified for the parent item. Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to `false` to prevent the parent item styles from overriding the subitem styles.

Docs.summary: Adds an array of subitems to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(string[] items) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of strings representing the text of each subitem to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Creates new subitems based on an array and adds them to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add an array of strings to the collection, where each string in the collection represents the text of a new subitem. You can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of strings as a parameter to specify the foreground color, background color, and font for each item being added. If you want to reuse existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and add them to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.

Docs.param: An array of objects to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an array of objects to the collection.

If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add an array of strings to the collection, where each string in the collection represents the text of a new subitem. In addition, this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method allows you to specify the foreground color, background color, and font for each subitem. You can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of strings as a parameter if you do not want to specify foreground color, background color, and font settings for each subitem. If you want to reuse existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and add them to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > By default, subitems use the foreground color, background color, and font specified for the parent item. Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to `false` to prevent the parent item styles from overriding the subitem styles.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
